pageContext.claim: “Driving here, there were tens of thousands of people on the streets with flags. And then you read these fake reporters and they say, uh, President Trump is tied in Nevada tied. I don't think so. The only way we're tied is if they screw around with the ballots, which they will do in my opinion, OK?”
pageContext.analysis: They were never tied and Trump ended up losing Nevada to Joe Biden. Reporters accurately noted during the campaign that Biden was ahead in the polls. Trump offers no evidence for his "opinion" that Nevada's election would be rigged, and couching it as an opinion doesn't make it any less dependent on a false premise. "Thousands of people on the streets" is an exaggeration. News reports and social media posts from reporters on the ground show there dozens at most.
